column1: Yago: A large ontology from wikipedia and wordnet,Fabian M Suchanek

column1: Database and information-retrieval methods for knowledge discovery,Gerhard Weikum

column9: the user has to either reformulate/refinethe query or manually inspect low-ranked results to find the person in question. A possibleapproach to solve this problem is to cluster the results
column10: so that each cluster represents one ofthe persons occurring in the answer set. However clustering search results has proven to bea difficult endeavor by itself
column11: where the clusters are typically of moderate quality. A wealth …,Data Engineering Workshops (ICDEW)

column1: A serendipity model for news recommendation,Maximilian Jenders
column5: Felix Naumann,Abstract Recommendation algorithms typically work by suggesting items that are similar tothe ones that a user likes
column6: or items that similar users like. We propose a content-basedrecommendation technique with the focus on serendipity of news recommendations.Serendipitous recommendations have the characteristic of being unexpected yet fortunateand interesting to the user
column7: and thus might yield higher user satisfaction. In our work
column8: weexplore the concept of serendipity in the area of news articles and propose a generalframework that incorporates the benefits of serendipity-and similarity-basedrecommendation techniques. An evaluation against other baseline recommendation modelsis carried out in a user study.,Joint German/Austrian Conference on Artificial Intelligence (Künstliche Intelligenz),2015,5

column1: Licon: A linear weighting scheme for the contribution ofinput variables in deep artificial neural networks,Gjergji Kasneci
column2: Thomas Gottron,Abstract In recent years artificial neural networks have become the method of choice formany pattern recognition tasks. Despite their overwhelming success
column3: a rigorous and easy tointerpret mathematical explanation of the influence of input variables on a output producedby a neural network is still missing. We propose a generic framework as well as a concretemethod for quantifying the influence of individual input signals on the output computed by adeep neural network. Inspired by the variable weighting scheme in the log-linearcombination of variables in logistic regression
column4: the proposed method provides linear modelsfor specific observations of the input variables. This linear model locally approximates thebehaviour of the neural network and can be used to quantify the influence of input variablesin a principled way. We demonstrate the effectiveness of the proposed method in …,Proceedings of the 25th ACM International on Conference on Information and Knowledge Management,2016,2
